channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The California wildfires could be leaving deeper inequality in their wake
'I can't believe my baby is not going to be here' - mother of fire victim
item.description: Shelley Sykes' son Rory, who had cerebral palsy and struggled with mobility, chose not to follow an evacuation order.

item.title: California fires death toll rises as L.A. area braces for more winds
item.description: Fires across the Los Angeles area have killed at least 24 people, and the Palisades and Eaton wildfires are still burning in Southern California.

item.title: Beloved 80-year-old Louisiana teacher gets surprise of a lifetime
item.description: When her beloved high school faced a teaching shortage, Frances Shaw came out of retirement. To honor her 52 years of service, she got a surprise that...

item.title: As dangerous winds are expected to pick up, Los Angeles braces for new fires
item.description: Damaging winds gusting between 55 and 70 mph are forecast, increasing fire risks across LA and Ventura counties over the next few days. More than 150,...

item.title: A dad and daughter help evacuees learn whether their homes survived the California wildfires
Breaking down outgoing FBI Director Christopher Wray's "60 Minutes" interview
item.description: FBI Director Christopher Wray spoke with "60 Minutes" in an interview that aired Sunday night about his planned resignation before President-elect Don...

item.title: Oliviero Toscani, Benetton's shock photographer, dies aged 82
item.description: Toscani was the creative force behind shock ad campaigns of the 1990s including a priest and nun kissing.

item.title: Maps and pictures chart how fires have spread
item.description: Maps and images showing how the fires currently affecting the Los Angeles area are developing.

item.title: Relative of Jack the Ripper victim demands new inquest
item.description: The true identity of Jack the Ripper, whose grisly murders terrorized east London in 1888, has been a mystery ever since.

item.title: Weird weather isn't always because of climate change â€” but sometimes it is
item.description: Sometimes, weather is just weather. And other times human-caused climate change had an obvious impact.

item.title: Winds threaten the containment of wildfires. And, DHS chief reflects on his career
item.description: Santa Ana winds are expected to pick back up, threatening the containment of Southern California wildfires. And, Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro...

item.title: Los Angeles wildfire death toll surges to 24 as firefighters brace for more fierce winds
item.description: A surging death toll is accompanying a slight break in the weather as firefighters in Los Angeles cast a wary eye on a forecast for yet more wind.

item.title: See some of the most terrifying and dramatic pictures of California wildfire devastation
item.description: These photos chronicle the catastrophic scale of destruction from wildfires in California that started on Jan. 7.

item.title: As L.A. fires burn, officials fight false rumors and misinformation
item.description: FEMA and the Los Angeles Fire Department are ramping up efforts to counter false rumors and misinformation spreading online about the wildfires.

item.title: Israel and Hamas make progress in their ceasefire and hostage release talks
item.description: Three officials said the next days would be critical for ending more than a year of fighting that has shaken the Middle East, but talks have stalled n...

item.title: Three things that could make a Gaza hostage deal more likely
item.description: There is fresh anticipation about the talks after several shifts, both politically and on the ground.

item.title: German-Iranian woman Nahid Taghavi released from prison in Tehran
item.description: Taghavi, 70, spent more than four years in jail after a trial that rights groups said was grossly unfair.
